WHISTLE STOP TOUR.Definition: a tour during which someone visits many places in a short period of time

SETTLEMENTS.Definition: places which people begin to occupy in order to create a community

CONVENIENTLY.Definition: in a way that causes the least difficulty

ESTUARY.Definition: the wide part of a river at the place where it meets the sea, a delta

TIDAL.Definition: affected by the rising and falling of the sea

SETTLEMENT.Definition: a place which people begin to occupy in order to create a community

HUB.Definition: a central place with a lot of activity

GLADIATORIAL AMPHITHEATRE.Definition: a Roman circular venue where people could watch trained fighters trying to kill other fighters or wild animals

INVOLUNTARILY.Definition: in a way that was against their will

TRIBE.Definition: a group of people with shared ethnic characteristics

INHERIT.Definition: receive from someone after they have died

FLOGGED.Definition: beaten with a stick or whip

WHIP.Definition: a flexible piece of leather with a handle, used for hitting people

BLOW.Definition: something that caused damage, a hit

BOUNCED BACK.Definition: started to be successful again after that difficult period

FELL INTO RUINS.Definition: was destroyed because no one took care of it

RAIDING PARTIES.Definition: groups of people who attacked in order to steal goods

CORONATION.Definition: the ceremony of naming someone king or installing a new monarch

SKYSCRAPERS.Definition: very tall buildings of many storeys or floors

ABBEY.Definition: a building where monks or nuns live

COMPARATIVELY.Definition: when compared to other similar things

GAME OF CAT AND MOUSE.Definition: situation in which one side tried to control the other

GET ONE UP ON EACH OTHER.Definition: have an advantage over each other

WIPED OUT.Definition: killed a large number of people

MEMORIAL.Definition: a structure that has been built to honour him

POLLUTING.Definition: making the air unclean by the addition of harmful substances

DOCKLANDS.Definition: the areas containing the city's docks or areas in a port for unloading and loading goods

METROPOLIS.Definition: a very large and important city

INFLUX.Definition: large number of people that arrived at the same time

GANG.Definition: a group of often young people

PICKPOCKETS.Definition: thieves who steal things out of pockets or bags

VILLAINS.Definition: bad people who break the law

PROSTITUTES.Definition: women who have sex in exchange for money

SERIAL KILLER.Definition: a person who commits a series of murders

EXAGGERATION.Definition: an act of making it sound more important than it is

SUBURBS.Definition: the areas on the edge of the city

SUBURBIA.Definition: the areas on the edge of the city considered as a group

OVERCROWDING.Definition: the presence of many people in one place

PRETEND.Definition: not really what it is represented as being

REIGN.Definition: the period during which she was queen

QUADRUPLED.Definition: been increased four times as much

DOCKS.Definition: areas in a port for unloading and loading goods

TRANSITION.Definition: the process of changing from one state to another

ADAPTABLE.Definition: able to adjust to new conditions

TO RESIST THE PULL OF.Definition: to refuse to accept its charm, its attractiveness

CRAZE.Definition: an excitement or enthusiasm for a particular thing

OMISSION.Definition: something that has been left out
